00001 #include "process_scheduler.h"
00002 #include <panic/panic.h>
00003 #include <stdlib.h>
00004 #include <common.h>

00007 struct process_entry_t
00008 {
00009         process_t* process_pointer;
00010         int ticks_tell_die;
00011 
00012         struct process_entry_t* next;
00013 };
00014 
00015 typedef struct process_entry_t scheduler_proc;
00016 
00017 scheduler_proc* list_root = 0;
00018 scheduler_proc* list_current = 0;
00019 
00020 void initializeScheduler(process_t* kp)
00021 {
00022         //Create and set new_process to all 0's
00023         scheduler_proc* new_process = malloc(sizeof(scheduler_proc));
00024         memset(new_process, 0, sizeof(scheduler_proc));
00025 
00026         //Set its process pointer to the kernels processing path
00027         new_process->process_pointer = kp;
00028         
00029         //Loop backs
00030         new_process->next = new_process;
00031 
00032         //Set the root and current set of the list to new_process
00033         list_root = new_process;
00034         list_current = new_process;
00035 }
00036 
00037 void scheduler_on_tick()
00038 {
00039         if (list_root == 0) return;
00040 
00041         if (list_current->ticks_tell_die < 1)
00042         {
00043                 if (list_current->next->process_pointer->m_shouldDestroy == 1)
00044                 {
00045                         process_t* current = list_current->next->process_pointer;
00046 
00047                         scheduler_remove(current);
00048                         freeProcess(current);
00049                 }
00050                 else
00051                 {
00052                         process_t* proc = list_current->process_pointer;
00053 
00054                         setKernelStack(KERNEL_STACK_START);
00055 
00056                         //Swap to the next process
00057                         list_current = list_current->next;
00058 
00059                         process_t* oproc = list_current->process_pointer;
00060 
00061                         //Give me a nano!
00062                         list_current->ticks_tell_die = _STD_NANO_;
00063 
00064                         //Swap to the new process
00065                         switch_process(proc, oproc);
00066                 }
00067 
00068         } else
00069         {
00070 
00071                 //increment the counter of the time spent on this process
00072                 list_current->process_pointer->m_processingTime++;
00073 
00074                 //One tick closer to being context switched
00075                 list_current->ticks_tell_die--;
00076         }
00077 }
00078 
00079 
00080 //To anybody calling this function, remember to re-enable interrupts where applicable
00081 void scheduler_add(process_t* op)
00082 {
00083         disable_interrupts();
00084 
00085         //Create and set new_process to all 0's
00086         scheduler_proc* new_process = malloc(sizeof(scheduler_proc));
00087         memset(new_process, 0, sizeof(scheduler_proc));
00088 
00089         new_process->process_pointer = op;
00090 
00091         unsigned int iterator = 0;
00092 
00093         scheduler_proc* iterator_process = list_root;
00094 
00095         //Loop to find the last entry in the list
00096         for(;;)
00097         {
00098                 if (iterator_process->next == list_root)
00099                 {
00100                         break;
00101                 }
00102                 else
00103                 {
00104                         iterator_process = iterator_process->next;
00105                 }
00106         }
00107 
00108         iterator_process->next = new_process;
00109 
00110         new_process->next = list_root;
00111 
00112 }
00113 
00114 //To anybody calling this, remember to re-enable interrupts
00115 void scheduler_remove(process_t* op)
00116 {
00117         disable_interrupts();
00118 
00119         //Find the scheduler entry
00120         scheduler_proc* iterator_process = list_root;
00121 
00122         for (;;)
00123         {
00124                 if (iterator_process->next == list_root)
00125                 {
00126                         return; //Cannot find the right proc
00127                 }
00128                 else
00129                 {
00130                         //Is the next process the one that needs to be killed
00131                         if (iterator_process->next->process_pointer == op)
00132                         {
00133                                 //Process
00134                                 break;
00135                         }
00136                         else
00137                         {
00138                                 iterator_process = iterator_process->next;
00139                         }
00140                 }
00141         }
00142 
00143         //Store the proc
00144         scheduler_proc* next = iterator_process->next;
00145 
00146         if (list_current == next)
00147         {
00148                 //If its currently being executed then go ahhhhh
00149                 list_current = next->next;
00150         }
00151 
00152         //Remove it from the list
00153         iterator_process->next = iterator_process->next->next;
00154 
00155         //Free it
00156         free(next);
00157 
00158         return;
00159 }
00160 
00161 //Sleeps the current process on the next tick
00162 void scheduler_block_me()
00163 {
00164         if (list_current == 0) return;
00165 
00166         list_current->ticks_tell_die = 0;
00167 }
00168 
00169 process_t* get_current_process()
00170 {
00171         if (list_current == 0) return 0;
00172 
00173         return list_current->process_pointer;
00174 }
00175 
00176 int scheduler_num_processes()
00177 {
00178         if (list_root == 0) return 0;
00179         
00180         scheduler_proc* iter = list_root;
00181 
00182         int numTotal = 0;
00183 
00184         while (1)
00185         {
00186                 numTotal++;
00187 
00188                 if (iter->next == list_root)
00189                 {
00190                         break;
00191                 }
00192                 
00193                 iter = iter->next;
00194         }
00195 
00196         return numTotal;
00197 }
00198 
00199 void scheduler_kill_current_process()
00200 {
00201         if (list_current == 0) return 0;
00202 
00203         get_current_process()->m_shouldDestroy = 1;
00204 
00205         for (;;)
00206         {
00207                 scheduler_on_tick(); //Fake ticks untill the next process is brought into context. Next time this process is handled by the scheduler it will be sent to /dev/null
00208         }
00209 }
00210 
00211 process_t* scheduler_return_process(unsigned int iter)
00212 {
00213         scheduler_proc* iterator = list_root;
00214         unsigned int i = 0;
00215 
00216         for (i = 0; i < iter; i++)
00217         {
00218                 if (iterator->next == list_root) return 0;
00219                 iterator = iterator->next;
00220         }
00221 
00222         return iterator->process_pointer;
00223 }
00224 
00225 void scheduler_global_message(process_message msg, unsigned int bit)
00226 {
00227         scheduler_proc* iter = list_root;
00228 
00229         while (1)
00230         {
00231                 //Test if this process wants to hear about this event
00232                 if (iter->process_pointer->m_postboxFlags & bit == bit)
00233                 {
00234                         postbox_add(&iter->process_pointer->m_processPostbox, msg);
00235 
00236                 }
00237 
00238                 if (iter->next == list_root) break;
00239 
00240                 iter = iter->next;
00241 
00242         }
00243 
00244 }
